instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 -2936 Half Chime now Dead.
threads.message:
Hey Duke. This board at first was only half chiming when I got it. Nothing plugged in except speaker. Minor liquid damage around clock. First thing I did was reoaired a trace leading to Y2805 and replaced the clock chip itself. After that I got full a chime for 1 or 2 boots then it went dead. Now the fucking thing is missing S3's and everything else down the line. And of course with my luck PM_SLP is missing!!! I'm getting kind of tired of being defeated by this type of issue. LOL. :) Do you think that because reworking the clock area got me a full chime a couple times that this being dead now is most likely related to clock/bios as well? What do you think I should do? Besides sell my equipment on Ebay.

Thanks man. Have a good one.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 -2936 Half Chime now Dead.
threads.message: Probably crap under the SMC and/or PCH. But could be any corroded trace/resistor really. R7402 also suspect.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 -2936 Half Chime now Dead.
threads.message: Hey Duke. You were right. Removed edge bonding from PCH and flowed some flux under it. Through in the cleaner and all good. Thanks again dude.
